page.title: 10SCHOOLS IN HIGH WYCOMBE
page.content:
High Wycombe's educational provision dates from{1813,}when{The British {School}opened. It later moved to Church Street in 1830.{The National School opened in{1853}and in{1873 {Priory Road School}was erected, at a cost of Â£8071. New schools were built as the town centre expanded.
For children from 5 to 12 years there are{First Schools}(5 to 8) and{Middle {Schools}(8 to 12) or{Combined Schools (5 to 12). At 12 a third of the children transfer to{Grammar Schools}selected on the basis of tests and recommendation of their headteachers. The others go to{Secondary Modern {Schools.}'O' level or 'CSE' courses for 16 year olds and 'A' level for 18 year olds can be taken at both types of school.
